item.description:
This is a wonderful walk that we've done a couple of times before. It will be easy and very scenic...

Join us for a relaxing walk through York, Maine. We'll take in tidal rivers, wiggly foot bridges, wilderness woods, a quaint village, rocky cliffs, and majestic ocean views...

We begin along the York River, crossing a little suspension foot bridge and through the woods. Then we can head along a path that will wend its way toward the ocean, where we'll hike along the cliff walk overlooking the sea.

Parking: Route 103/Lilac Lane just north of the York River - there is parking along the road.

In case of snowy or icy weather, bring your microspikes and hiking poles - or your snowshoes if necessary.

And we can duck into the pub at York Harbor Inn for a drink by the fire afterward!

Liability Release

AS A CONDITION OF ATTENDING THIS MEETUP, YOU AGREE TO hold harmless, and indemnify the organizer and his heirs, and all members and participants of the Seacoast Outdoors Meetup group from any and all claims for injury, illness, death, and/or property damage including those caused by negligence, ignorance, inexperience and other reasons. You also agree to assume all mental, physical, financial, and/or other risk associated with this meetup. Kayaking, camping, hiking, bicycling, snow sports, alcohol consumption, and other activities pose inherent risks and dangers. Participation in these activities is voluntary and dependent upon your own personal judgment.

Time and location are subject to change due to weather and other factors.  Always check email & this listing for updates before leaving home.
item.name: Wiggly Cliff Walk III
